meanings.sent1: After the storm, the farmer had to recultivate his fields to grow new crops.
meanings.sent2: The gardener decided to recultivate the flower bed to make it more beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The farmer joked that he needed to recultivate the soil because the plants were on vacation.
meanings.sent4: She hoped to recultivate her friendship with her childhood friend after years of being apart.
meanings.sent5: The idea to recultivate the old garden brought back memories of happy times.

meanings.definition: To improve or restore the fertility of (land) by agricultural means.
meanings.sent1: The farmers worked hard to recultivate the barren land and make it productive again.
meanings.sent2: Using organic compost helped recultivate the soil and increase crop yield.
meanings.sent3: The community came together to recultivate the neglected farmland and turn it into a thriving garden.
meanings.sent4: Their efforts to recultivate the land transformed it into a lush green landscape.
meanings.sent5: The innovative techniques used to recultivate the fields amazed everyone with the results.

meanings.definition: To renew or revive (a practice, habit, etc.).
meanings.sent1: She decided to recultivate her interest in painting after many years of not practicing.
meanings.sent2: The school aims to recultivate the tradition of community service among its students.
meanings.sent3: He tried to recultivate his love for reading by starting with his favorite childhood book.
meanings.sent4: The team captain's pep talk helped recultivate the spirit of teamwork among the players.
meanings.sent5: The workshop was designed to recultivate creativity in individuals through various exercises.
